THE TWENTIETH CENTURY AMERICAN
This is the continuing theme of the three-year plan for the
development of educational radio programming supported by
the Educational Television and Radio Center. With this
announcement, producers of educational radio programs are
invited to submit applications fdr grants-in-aid during 1958—
the second year of the plan.
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters will
continue its active participation in the operation of the plan,
soliciting and evaluating grants proposals, advising on program
series to be commissioned, and supplying programs from both
sources to the 81 non-commercial educational stations regularly
served by the NAEB Radio Network.
PURPOSE
Again this year, it is the purpose of this support to assist in
the development of programs which will use radio broadcasting
to aid in a better understanding of and a more effective re¬
sponse to the challenges and opportunities of Twentieth Cen¬
tury American life. The Modern American—in his own time and
in his own country—is the focal character of the plan. The ulti¬
mate goal of the programs is to develop or augment the ability
of the American to meet the unprecedented demands made
upon his understanding by life in the Twentieth Century.
Proposals will be evaluated on the hasis of their educational
purpose and their focus upon significant aspects of the heritage
and of the contemporary forces that shape and condition The
Twentieth Century American.
